product.label: The Product
product.title:
LocalPDF:
PDF Tools That Respect You
product.subtitle: A powerful suite of PDF tools running entirely on your machine. No cloud required.
product.feature1_desc: Shrink PDFs with smart presets (Email, Web, Print). Process hundreds of files at once with batch mode.
product.feature2_desc: Combine multiple PDFs into one or split a PDF by pages, ranges, or into individual files. Drag-and-drop reorder.
product.feature3_desc: Add AES-256 passwords, set permissions, or overlay text and image watermarks with live preview. Unlock password-protected PDFs too.
product.feature4_desc: Image to PDF, PDF to Image (PNG/JPEG at 72-600 DPI), PPT/PPTX to PDF. Drag-and-drop multiple images with reorder support.
product.feature5_desc: Edit PDF pages with annotations, eraser tool, text overlays, image stamps, and signature support. Full page management with insert and reorder.

q1.question: How can this be completely free?
q1.answer: LocalPDF runs entirely on your device, so we have zero cloud infrastructure costs. No servers to maintain, no bandwidth to pay for. We believe PDF tools should be accessible to everyone. Our code is open source under MIT license - audit it yourself.

q2.question: What PDF tools are included?
q2.answer: LocalPDF includes 10 tools: Compress, Batch Compress, Merge, Split, Protect/Unlock (AES-256), Watermark (text & image with live preview), Image to PDF, PDF to Image, PPT to PDF, and a full PDF Page Editor with annotations, eraser, and signature support.

q3.question: Will this work without an internet connection?
q3.answer: Absolutely! LocalPDF works 100% offline right out of the box. No downloads, no setup, no internet needed. Process documents on airplanes, in remote locations, or in air-gapped environments.

q4.question: Can I use this for commercial work?
q4.answer: Yes! LocalPDF is MIT licensed. Use it for personal projects, client work, or commercial products. No attribution required (though always appreciated).

q5.question: What PDF formats and sizes are supported?
q5.answer: LocalPDF handles standard PDF files of any size - no page or file size limits. It works with text-based PDFs, image-heavy documents, and mixed-content PDFs containing images and tables.

q6.question: What are the system requirements?
q6.answer:
Minimum: 4GB RAM, 200MB free storage, macOS 11.0 (Big Sur) or later
Recommended: 8GB RAM, Apple Silicon for best performance. Windows and Linux coming soon.
